_header: Queen of heaven of hell eke empress
_description: John Lydgate, Verses On the Five Joys addressed to the Virgin Mary — seven 8-line stanzas(ababbcbc) and an Envoy of 28 lines (3 8-line stanzas, ababbcbc and four-line verba compilatoris, abba)

BodHat73.First Lines:
Qvene of heuen and of helle emperresseLady of this worlde verrey
                    lode sterre…
BodHat73.Last Lines:
…To make you strong be ware forgete hem nought On cristes
                    passioun and on hir Ioyes fyve

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Queen of hevene of helle eek Empresselady of this world o verray
                    loode sterre…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…on cristis passioun and on hir Ioies ffyveto make yow strong
                    be war for get hem nouht
BodLauMis683.Note:
Envoy complete, not only 20 lines as recorded in Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943.
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title: Here begynneth a prayer on to our lady (f. 17)

BodRawC48.First Lines:
QVeen of heuene of Helle eek emperesselady of this world o varray
                    lood sterr…
BodRawC48.Last Lines:
…On cristis passioun and on hir Ioies fyue make you strong bi
                    war for gete hem nouht
BodRawC48.Note:
Envoy complete, not only 20 lines as recorded in Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943.
BodRawC48.Attributed Title: Here begynneth a prayer on to our lady (f. 17)

BodTan110.First Lines:
Qween of heuene of helle eeke EmperesseLady of this world O verray
                    loodsterre…
BodTan110.Last Lines:
…On Cristys passyoun and on hir Ioyes fyveTo make you strong
                    bewar forget hem nouht
BodTan110.Note:
Second occurrence in this MS; written by a different hand(?); ten 8-line
                    stanzas and one quatrain.

CULKk16.First Lines:
Qvene of heuene of Helle eeke EmperesseLady of this Worlde O verrey
                    loode sterre…
CULKk16.Last Lines:
…On cristus Passion & on here Ioyes ffyueTo make ȝow
                    stronge be war for get hem nought
CULKk16.Attributed Title:
Here…begyneth an holy preyer to oure moste blesset Lady Seynt Mari of
                    here V Ioyes. Lydgate (f. 199)

CamJes56.First Lines:
[O] quene of heuen of hell eeke emperesLady of þis worlde o
                    verrey loode sterre…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…To make you strong be ware forget þamOn Cristes passion
                    and on hir Ioyes fyue

CamTCC601.First Lines:
quene of heuyn of hell eke Emperesselady of thys world o verrey
                    loode sterreTo marynerys geyn all martall distresseIn theyre passage
                    that they ne erre…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…On Crystes passion & on her ioyes fyueTo make yow strong
                    beware foryete hem nought
CamTCC601.Attributed Author:
Lydgate (added next to ‘lenuoy’, f. 168; added next to
                    ‘Explicit’, f. 168v)

BLHar2255.First Lines:
Queen of heuene of helle Eek emperesselady of this world O verray
                    lood sterre…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…On cristis passioun and on hir Ioyes fyveTo make you strong
                    be war forget hem nouht
BLHar2255.Attributed Title: Incipit de Sancta Maria (f. 111v, in rubric)

Lam344.First Lines:
Qvene of heuene and of helle emperesseLady of thys world verrey
                    lood sterre…
Lam344.Last Lines:
…To make you strange be ware forget her nowghtIn crystes
                    passyon and on hyre Ioyes fyve
